wikipedia_page.main: Professor Thomas Hugh Milroy FRSE (1869 – 20 March 1950) was a Scottish physiologist and organic chemist.

response: *Thomas Hugh Milroy LLD FRSE (1869–1950), Scottish physiologist and academic
*Thomas Hugh Milroy FRSE born here in 1869
* Prof Thomas Hugh Milroy LLD FRSE (1869–1950) physiologist, organic chemist and Vice President of the Royal Society of Edinburgh
In 1944 he was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh. His proposers were Ernest Cruickshank, Thomas Hugh Milroy, Sir Alister Hardy and James Robert Matthews.
